content.prompt:
• For the first curve:   
    • Moving from left to right:
      • The curve passes from quadrant 2 to quadrant 1.
      • The curve trends up gradually then sharply.
      • The curve is asymptotic to the x axis.
      • The curve passes through the following approximate points:
        • (negative 2 comma 0.2)
        • (negative 1 comma 0.4)
        • (0 comma 1)
        • (1 comma 3)
        • (1.5 comma 5)
  • For the second curve:
    • Moving from left to right: 
      • The curve passes from quadrant 4 to quadrant 1.
      • The curve trends up sharply then gradually.
      • The curve is asymptotic to the y axis.
      • The curve passes through the following approximate points:
        • (0.2 comma negative 2)
        • (0.4 comma negative 1)
        • (1 comma 0)
        • (3 comma 1)
        • (5 comma 1.5)
  • For the first curve: 
    • Moving from left to right:
      • The curve passes from quadrant 2 to quadrant 3.
      • The curve trends down gradually then sharply.
      • The curve is asymptotic to the y axis.
      • The curve passes through the following approximate points:
        • (negative 5 comma 1.5)
        • (negative 3 comma 1)
        • (negative 1 comma 0)
        • (negative 0.4 comma negative 1)
        • (negative 0.2 comma negative 2)
  • For the second curve:
    • Moving from left to right: 
      • The curve passes from quadrant 2 to quadrant 1.
      • The curve trends down sharply then gradually.
      • The curve is asymptotic to the x axis.
      • The curve passes through the following approximate points:
        • (negative 1.5 comma 5)
        • (negative 1 comma 3)
        • (0 comma 1)
        • (1 comma 0.4)
        • (2 comma 0.2)
  • For the first curve:
    • Moving from left to right:
      • The curve passes from quadrant 2 to quadrant 1.
      • The curve trends up gradually then sharply.
      • The curve is asymptotic to the x axis.
      • The curve passes through the following approximate points:
        • (negative 2 comma 0.2)
        • (negative 1 comma 0.4)
        • (0 comma 1)
        • (1 comma 3)
        • (1.5 comma 5)
  • For the second curve:
    • Moving from left to right:
      • The curve passes from quadrant 3 to quadrant 4.
      • The curve trends down gradually then sharply.
      • The curve is asymptotic to the x axis.
      • The curve passes through the following approximate points:
        • (negative 2 comma negative 0.2)
        • (negative 1 comma negative 0.4)
        • (0 comma negative 1)
        • (1 comma negative 3)
        • (1.5 comma negative 5)
  • For the first curve:
    • Moving from left to right:
      • The curve passes from quadrant 2 to quadrant 1.
      • The curve trends up gradually then sharply.
      • The curve is asymptotic to the x axis.
      • The curve passes through the following approximate points:
        • (negative 2 comma 0.2)
        • (negative 1 comma 0.4)
        • (0 comma 1)
        • (1 comma 3)
        • (1.5 comma 5)
  • For the second curve:
    • Moving from left to right:
      • The curve passes from quadrant 2 to quadrant 1.
      • The curve trends down sharply then gradually.
      • The curve is asymptotic to the x axis.
      • The curve passes through the following approximate points:
        • (negative 1.5 comma 5)
        • (negative 1 comma 3)
        • (0 comma 1)
        • (1 comma 0.4)
        • (2 comma 0.2)

The functions f and g are inverse functions such that gx=f-1x. Which of the following could be the graphs of y=fx and y=gx in the same xy-plane?

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
